revised_title: Steady-state Thermoelasticity for Initially Stressed Bodies: Applications and Solutions
tldr: The authors study the thermoelasticity of initially stressed bodies subjected to small deformations and steady-state temperature distributions. They provide a general analysis and solutions for specific cases, such as a plane circular crack in an infinite medium and half-space problems. This work extends previous research on infinitesimal elasticity and contributes to the understanding of stress and temperature interactions in materials.
